content.prompt: Political participation in authoritarian regimes differs from that in democratic regimes in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Voluntary political participation does not occur in authoritarian regimes and does occur in democratic regimes.
There are no avenues for political participation in authoritarian regimes and there are in democratic regimes.
Authoritarian regimes do not respond to citizen participation while democratic regimes do respond.
State organized participation is more likely to occur in authoritarian regimes than in democratic regimes.
Grassroots political participation does not occur in authoritarian regimes but does occur in democratic regimes.

topic.text: 3.5: Nature and Role of Political Participation

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Compare political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
